usecase.commu.chat

Interface ChatEnroll

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Announcement

    public interface ChatEnroll
    This interface defines the enrolling method for a chat. The chats that can hold an arbitrary number (not fixed) of people should implement this.

    Note : not every chats supports enroll, for example DirectChat doesn't support enroll. Because it's only defined for two people.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void deleteFor(java.util.UUID caster, java.util.UUID person)
      Remove the record for person.
      void enrollFor(java.util.UUID caster, java.util.UUID person, AccessLevel initialAccess)
      Create a record for person.

    • Method Detail

      • enrollFor

        void enrollFor(java.util.UUID caster,
               java.util.UUID person,
               AccessLevel initialAccess)
        Create a record for person. If there is not enough capacity, throws a CapacityException. If the record for that person already exist do nothing.

        There are two kinds of enrollment, self enrollment, manager enrollment. Self enrollment means some one is enrolling for themself, some chat permits this kinds of enrollment. Manager enrollment requires the caster to have AccessLevel.MANAGE access, otherwise it will throws a AccessException.

        Parameters:
        caster - the caster of this operation.
        person - the owner of the new create chat.
        initialAccess - the initial access level.
        Throws:
        AccessException - if the caster doesn't have AccessLevel.MANAGE access.

      • deleteFor

        void deleteFor(java.util.UUID caster,
               java.util.UUID person)
        Remove the record for person. Set the access of that person to AccessLevel.UNDEFINED.

        This method deletes the chat record for the person, so only the person itself can perform this action.

        Parameters:
        caster - the caster of this operation.
        person - the person that is effected by this operation.
        Throws:
        AccessException - if the caster and person is not the same.
